page.title: 08Portland Museum
page.content:
The Portland Museum building is in three parts. Originally a 17th century cottage was donated to Portland by Dr. Marie Stopes in 1929. The thatched cottage is known locally as Avice's Cottage as it was so named by Thomas Hardy who describes it in his novel The Well-Beloved. The New Gallery is a recent addition commissioned during the curatorship of Mr. Jack West. The museum displays a wealth of local artefacts and tells the history of the Island in paintings and photographs. The collection of local shipwreck information is extensively illustrated. The museum became part of the Weymouth and Portland Museum Service in 1974 and shares its curator with Weymouth Museum.
Liz Bartlett
